pages.text: Customization is an integral feature for individualistic aspirations and compatibility. For that reason, many aspects of the mod are changeable through the config and/or data packs. Information in this Journal might not be reflective of those changes. Here are some of those changes that can be made.

pages.title: Mandatory Axe
pages.text: It's all about realism, and so of course there has to be a way to stop tree punching. This will require players to make a flint axe (or other mod equivalent) prior to chopping down trees. An update to this config will allow players to break logs by hand, but not "chop down trees".

pages.title: Disable Vanilla Tools
pages.text: As of 1.3.0, vanilla tools are enabled by default and accounted for in the progression scheme. The mod can be played without them and so this group of settings can disable each of the vanilla tools.

pages.title: Movement Modifiers
pages.text: Movement speed of entities can be affected by the blocks they are walking on. Categories of blocks are be set by a tag and assigned a speed modifier in the config. Negative values mean slower walking (like on sand and snow) while positive values increase speed (roman concrete is the fastest currently). The movementModifiersEnabled setting globaly enables or disables all speed factors.
